error.signature: ERROR: Cannot install package-a and package-b because these package versions have conflicting dependencies

verdict.summary: pip cannot find a set of package versions that satisfies all dependency constraints.

dead_ends.why_fails: Installs incompatible versions; imports will fail at runtime
May install breaking versions of dependencies

workarounds.action: Use pip install --dry-run to see the conflict, then pin compatible versions
workarounds.how: pip install --dry-run package-a package-b shows which versions conflict

workarounds.action: Use pipdeptree to visualize the dependency tree and find the conflict point
workarounds.how: pipdeptree --warn silence shows the full tree; pipdeptree -p package shows deps for one package

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Both produce similar messages, but 'inconsistent-requirements' and 'dependency-resolver-conflict' differ in root cause and environment context.
